description: Have the floors of the patient hot-zone lined with a kind of rubber grid like the ones you see at the ice rinks...  that would let the contaminated body fluids go down and not be stepped on or splashed by boots of care workers... and at the bottom where the blood goes, have the entire floor be kind of like a bin... with raised edges on all four sides, so that it can hold a chlorine bleach solution that will immediately disinfect contaminated body fluids that flow to the floor.
summary: Ice-rink style rubber floor grids to keep shoes from splashing contaminated body fluids on floor.  Floor with edges on four sides to make entire floor hold a chlorine solution that once the contaminated body fluid flows to the floor, the chlorine immediately disinfects it and the shoes stay off the floor.
title: re: Rubber flooring grids 'a la ice rink' for HOT-ZONE floors
